answers.answer: You know, lots of people post this question and I still can't understand why the heck doctors do an u/s so freaking early and scare people like this.I don't know if this will make you feel better or not, but it's okay that you didn't see anything.  You're only 5.5 weeks - there's not much anyone can see.  There's no reason to worry at this point - it's very common to not see anything right now.
My Dr. said when we do get pregnant that our first u/s will somewhere between 7-8 weeks because they can't see much before that.

i agree, i think way to many doctors are doing them too early, just makeing people go crazy with worry, and if she said she saw something, you said u didnt see anything, but she did, i would trust her, she is the one who does that for a living, she knows what to look for. 5 weeks really is early i wouldnt worry too much

I dont really trust her because she always talks before she knows 100% what shes talking about... She used a vaginal ultrasound and she did it for a while she said this is the yolk sac and explained what it was for but when she was telling me there was NOTHING there? I was pretty confused. Then she said a few times she thought she saw a flickering of a heartbeat  and tried to look for a while but then didn't feel good about what she said and then told me she wanted me to go back in 2 weeks so she could do another ultrasound and find the heartbeat. Im changing doctors though and im seeing a new one in a week at a new office. I just dont like her. She doesn't spend enough time with me and never answers my questions. I have a high risk pregnancy as it is. I have 2 babies who are 3 and 1. My first was born at 33 weeks because of severe preeclampsia and my next was born at 35 weeks because of mild preeclampsia and preterm labor plus I just had a miscarriage in Sept.Im REALLY trying so hard not to worry right now and just make it to my next appt I just wish I had an answer ya know?
it really is too early. Try not to worry.

If he's gagging then it's probably too thick for his liking.  Drop back to a soupy mixture and start working your way up again.  Stage 2 foods are exactly the same as Stage 1 foods, they just come in more varieties and bigger jars.  If he eats Stage 1 then Stage 2 should be no different.  The texture gets different only when you enter Stage 3 jars.  Don't push him, just feed him what he likes.  Does he eat the meats??  Try to get those into him - that little jar is packed with protein.
Well, he will eat the turkey/sweet potatoes, chicken/sp, I tried Apples and chicken and he gagged until I quit.  He is just not really interested in food.  UGH!
HAVE THEM CHECK HIS ADENOIDS(SP) THEY MAY BE TOO LARGE, MY FRIENDS SON COULDNT EAT ANYTHING CHUNKY UNTIL HE HAD HIS OUT AT 3. AND HE WAS SNORING, JUST A THOUGHT ANYWAYS

The apples/chicken is really tangy.  I'd gag too  :-)I was actually referring to the little jars that are pure meat.  They are beef with beef gravy, chicken with chicken gravy, turkey with turkey gravy, etc. etc.  If he'll eat that with some veggies then you know he's getting some good protein.If all he'll eat is turkey/sp or chicken/sp then feed him that.  Don't worry if he's picky, just feed him.

OH, no I have never given him those.  I guess maybe I should get some.  He is my first and I am super cautious!  I will ask about the adenoids today at the doc.  We are seeing a different one because his normal one is not in the office.  Maybe if I like this one better I will request a change if he will take a new patient (a patient from a partner).  THanks.

Hello everyone!  This is my first time here. I am glad I found this site.  Anyways this is my second pregnancy first one was 10 years ago.  So it's like my first all over again.  Anyways, I have spent the first four weeks of my pregnancy speaking with my doctor because of some belly pain and spotting I am having.  I keep reading about everyones hcg levels and mine seem to be very high however he tells me they are normal.  My hcg levels on monday (mind you I was only 3wks 3 days) were 51,000.  Last friday they were 15,420.  So with saying this anyone know about having twins?? I believe in psychics and I had 2 tell me I was having twins.  However I am more afraid of miscarrying because I had cervical cancer and had surgery in September and had 2 inches deep removed off the entire cervix and I was not suppose to be able to get pregnant.  So the doctor and everyone are surprised by this.  He says so far everything is okay and the bleeding can be normal.  But I'm not so certain cause I get sharp pains all the time and they cause me to double over and then they go away.  Needs some advice thanks.

That is right, there wouldn't be a yolk sac if it was a blighted ovum. I went through the same garbage with Tristan. They did an u/s at what I thought was 6 weeks, turned out it was 5 weeks 5 days,lol. What a huge difference those 2 days make in the beginning! They saw the sac & fetal pole, but they had to really hunt for it.I know they think they were doing me a favor by doing it early, but it stressed me out!!Keep your chin up, the fetal pole is a good sign!Andi
Thanks everyone. Im hoping for the best. Im kinda feeling down right now and I prob will for the next week. I hate waiting!

I just wanted to thank everyone that chimed in on my questions about my little boy's chronic cough.  We went to the doc this afternoon and they think it is either allergies or asthma.  He gave me a Rx for Singular to see if that helps.  He said it would help both (allergies and asthma).  So, we will see what happens.  Thanks again.

that's great. I hope he's better soon. Poor little guy. I have a friend who's son has asthma. When he was younger it was really bad. He's 5 now though and since they put him on Singulair he's been much better.

Your friend's son's asthma got better with Singulair?  Did they know it was asthma from the start?  My niece has asthma and they never tried Singulair, the went straight to a breathing treatment every night.  She is 3 now and seems to have grown out of it so far.  Well, I hope it works.

He has less episodes and gets sick less often. That's what I meant. LOL. I'm not sure if they knew it was asthma from the start, I've only known her since he was 2. He was a preemie though, so he's had lots of trouble off and on.  I know she has to use a nebulizer and some kind of breathing treatment on him once a week, but I don't know what that medication is called. I can ask her if you're interested. Just let me know.

I just had the same problem- we are in the same boat. My LMP was 10-26 and I ovulated on day 16 too. My u/s was monday, and all they saw was the gestational sac- no yolk sac or fetal pole. He said it was normal at 5 weeks 1 day, but I am REALLY nervous- he didnt seem that optimistic, especially since I had a miscarriage in September. My HCGs are really good and doubling, and my progesterone is good, so I have a little hope. Doesnt it make you crazy waiting!!! I cant believe I have to wait 2 more weeks. They cant see a heartbeat until after 6 weeks, and a fetal pole at 5.5, I think. The yolk sac being there is a very good sign- I dont think the yolk sac is ever there in a blighted ovum. Good luck and keep us posted. I am SO feeling your pain on not seeing anything on the u/s and having to wait.

i saw everthing at 6 weeks vag ultrasound pritty clearly with a heart rate of over 100hb a minute could be the quality of ther equipment at 6 weeks via vag ultrasound you should see something best of luck.

neither of my boys liked the meat and gravy, they did however like the meat and fruit  or meat and veggies....chicken and applesauce being one of them.............dont ask me why, cuz i still dont know.

My 4 year old has reactive airway disease which is like asthma induced by bronchitis, he would get an ear infection which would drain to his tonsils and adenoids, and then he would get that horrible cough that would make it hard for him to breath like asthma.  They put him on oral steroids (prednizone) when he was really little and when I left the military and got a real pediatrician they gave me a nebulizer (breathing machine) and put him on Xopenex and Pulmicort.  He also has an inhaler.  We had ear tubes put in at 13 months and tonsils and adenoids out at 2 years. Once we had the tonsils and adenoids out, he hasn't had a real attack (and he has been a lot healthier not to mention started sleeping through the night!) thank goodness!  Now we just use the inhaler or the nebulizer if he starts sounding a little wheezy.  He is also on Walmart Brand Claritin Quick Disolve tabs for allergies.The Xopenex is the airway opener and the pulmicort is the steroid.Hope this helps!

question: Well I just went to the Doctor on Tuesday. I was 5 weeks and 4 days by my LMP (Oct-28) I know for sure that I ovulated on day 16 of my cycle since I was charting and I got a positive htp at 8 dpo anyway... When they did my ultrasound all we could see is an empty sac. She "said" she saw the yolk sac but I really dont think she did since I didn't see ANYTHING and im really could with ultrasound and I was sitting there watching the whole thing. She also did it for a while. Im guessing she was a little worried since she set me up for another ultrasound in 2 weeks. Im not going back to her again though because I always feel confused when I leave there and still have questions. Im going to a new doctor on Dec-14 which will make me 6+ weeks and i'll get a new ultrasound. Im very worried though that there was only a gas sac found. Shouldn't there have at least been a nice yolk sac found? Thank you!
title: Another ultrasound question.... 5 1/2 weeks
